title: ICE in typeck on existential return type in trait

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

body:
https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=6988f4162312bdf3adc80228efabb896

```rust
#![feature(existential_type)]

trait UnwrapItemsExt {
    type II;
    fn unwrap_items(self) -> Self::II;
}

impl<I, T, E> UnwrapItemsExt for I 
where
    I: Iterator<Item = Result<T, E>>,
    E: std::fmt::Debug,
{
    existential type II: Iterator<Item = T>;
    
    fn unwrap_items(self) -> Self::II {
        self.map(|x| x.unwrap())
    }
}
```
